intro: Meyna laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered meyna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and typically have a rough texture. Meyna laxiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
